title: A Shining Moment of Pan-African Promise in a New Book
description: Marilyn Nance was 23 when she photographed FESTAC ’77, the immense gathering of Black artists in Nigeria. In ‘Last Day in Lagos,’ she shares her archive.
dc:creator: Siddhartha Mitter
media:credit: Lelanie Foster for The New York Times
media:description: Marilyn Nance, at right, the photographer and author of “Last Day in Lagos,” which was edited by Oluremi C. Onabanjo, below left, seen at Nance’s home in Brooklyn.
